channel.title: What is Minecraft?
channel.description:
Okay, so it's about time I asked. What's the story with Minecraft. Is it another RPG that someone has cracked and made a private server from? What do you do exactly on Minecraft?
It kinda reminds me of Doom.

item.title: What is Minecraft?
item.dc:creator: @xryz xryz
item.description:
@xryz wrote:

ok well the minimum space requirement for xubuntu is 2 gb. so if that helps i would guess a 2gb thumb drive would do fine. since you said you cant get an 8gb one. i believe u can even install applications running on a live disc, the downside is when u restart u will have to reinstall those programs. just trying to help u to play minecraft.

Read full topic

item.title: What is Minecraft?
item.dc:creator: @savva100 savva100
item.description:
@savva100 wrote:

dude minecraft something like a reallife thing to survive!
but there are no sombies , skeletons, and creepers ;D

making houses slaughter pigs and cows and another things and more more more!!<<<and make food of them

try it out is accualy a addict game after a while its meaby boring but at the start its awesom and its awesom when you play a multiplayer and you are the owner of it with alot of people!

item.title: What is Minecraft?
item.dc:creator: @xryz xryz
item.description:
@xryz wrote:

im pretty sure you know this. if possible u can get an 8gb thumb drive. burn a linux livecd distro(i suggest a lightweight distro like xubuntu) to a blank cd. boot by the cd drive. when you get to the installation stuff; insert thumbdrive; when you get to the partition part, find the thumbdrive; partition the whole drive to ext4(no swap); let it do the installation. when its done eject the disc; keep the thumbdrive in, then boot into the usb drive. when the os boots, it may already have openjdk installed if you choose that option, if not you can find the information needed to install sun java(openjdk works too but i usually use sun’s). get the crack client from CoonHunter(link in the official server thread). go into terminal run this command, “sudo chmod 777 ‘path/to/minecraft/launcher’” put in the pass you created. now you can run it. it should run correctly. that client should download all the nessecary files. if you have any problems I or anyone else should be able to help.

Read full topic

item.title: What is Minecraft?
item.dc:creator: @CoonHunter CoonHunter
item.description:
@CoonHunter wrote:

Mendorphins:

I want to stay with Windows, thanks. Anyone else?

You could try a modded driver. That can be dangerous though, so make sure you have a restore cd and a disc image backup ready if its not working. Or, install Ubuntu onto a 8GB thumb drive. (i suggest ubuntu on thumb drive, its easier than finding a modded driver and hoping it works.)

Read full topic

item.title: What is Minecraft?
item.dc:creator: @Mendorphins Mendorphins
item.description:
@Mendorphins wrote:

I attempted to do so but for one my Video Controller in my Device Manager just displayed VGA and all my Video Card information is .

I went to Realteks website to download a driver and all I get is a Device Detective.exe that wants me to register and pay for me to update my drivers.

Same with ATI.

The Windows Wizard doesn’t find anything either, any suggestions? I’m really up for playing Minecraft.

Read full topic
